data.title: Ubisoft teases its Splinter Cell remake, hints at whatâ€™s changing
data.meta_description: Ubisoft shows off new concept art and gameplay improvements for its remake of Tom Clancyâ€™s Splinter Cell in a new 20th anniversary video for the franchise.
data.text:
Ubisoftâ€™s upcoming remake of the original Tom Clancyâ€™s Splinter Cell is still in its early production and prototyping phase, creative director Chris Auty said in a newly released video celebrating the Splinter Cell franchiseâ€™s 20th anniversary, but its creators offered a taste of whatâ€™s to come on Thursday, in terms of new features and concept art for the game.

As previously discussed by the Splinter Cell remake team, Ubisoft Toronto is â€œlook[ing] back at the plot, the characters, and the overall story of the original game,â€ Auty said, and making some improvements to â€œthings that may not have aged particularly well,â€ but pledged that â€œthe core of the story, the core of the experience will remain as it was the original game.â€

Christian Carriere, technical director, touched on the technical innovations planned for the Splinter Cell remake, highlighting advancements in AI that will simulate different kind of behaviors and reactions from enemies. â€œObviously a special forces soldier will be better trained,â€ Carriere said, â€œ[and] theyâ€™re going to breach differently or enter rooms differently to something like a regular security guard would.â€

â€œWe can really improve AI engagement, how theyâ€™re reacting and what theyâ€™re reacting to,â€ added Andy Schmoll, senior game designer. â€œAnd with all of that we can make improvements to the cat-and-mouse gameplay between Sam and the enemies, especially with our enemies behaving like trained professionals.â€

Carriere also touted audiovisual updates like ray-traced global illumination for much more realistic lighting effects and better audio simulations, that will help â€œcreate some really, really, really compelling and detailed settings.â€

The Splinter Cell remake team said theyâ€™re â€œgoing darkâ€ for a while to focus on making the game, offering only a few glimpses of what players can expect in the form of early artwork. You can see some of that in the gallery below.
